alert.note: Alert for Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Yavapai County Mountains; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 03 at 3:24AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...An area of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Coconino and Yavapai Counties through 415 AM MST... At 323 AM MST, Doppler radar was tracking an area of strong thunderstorms near Village At Oak Creek, or 9 miles south of Sedona, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Sedona, Mcguireville, Village At Oak Creek, Montezuma Well, Montezuma Castle National Monument, Page Springs, Lake Montezuma, Cornville, Rimrock, Wet Beaver Creek Campground, Red Rock State Park and V Bar V Visitors Center. This includes the following highways... Interstate 17 between mile markers 293 and 307. State Route 179 between mile markers 299 and 313. State Route 89A between mile markers 369 and 374. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Yavapai County Mountains; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins
